definition[0]: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone
example[0]: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
explanation[0]: Fabricate is used mainly in writing, for example in journalism and legal contexts. In everyday English, people usually say make something up:
example[1]: They accused him of making the whole thing up.
definition[1]: to make or produce goods or equipment
example[2]: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
definition[2]: to make something, using tools, special machines, or an industrial process
example[3]: Samsung will fabricate its own microprocessor.
example[4]: The steel frame was fabricated by a company based in Scotland.
